info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 2:18PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHERN STILLWATER... SOUTHEASTERN WHEATLAND...SOUTHWESTERN GOLDEN VALLEY AND NORTHEASTERN SWEET GRASS COUNTIES THROUGH 300 PM MDT... At 216 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles south of Harlowton, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northern Stillwater, southeastern Wheatland, southwestern Golden Valley and northeastern Sweet Grass Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
